did.abstract: The papers cover the years 1955 and 1956 during which the International Longshoremen's Association negotiated a new agreement with the New York Shipping Association and opposed the employment stabilization program of the Waterfront Commission.

scopecontent.p: The International Longshoremen's Association opposed the employment stabilization program of the Waterfront Commission.
Correspondence, hearings, newspaper clippings, and other material relating to negotiations is included.
